title: Am I the only one who notices the huge Soraka buffs this patch?

embed.description: Gyazo lets you instantly grab the screen and upload the image/GIF to the web. You can easily share them on Chat, Twitter, Blog, Tumblr, etc. Available for Windows, Mac and Linux.

body:
{{champion:16}}  was given huge buffs this patch that not many people seem to notice or talk about on the Boards from what I've seen.
---
* Grevious Wounds no longer effect heals on other champions
* Grevious Wounds lowered from 50% to 40%
* Intelligence mastery lets her heal be on an extremely low cooldown
* Windspeaker's Blessing makes her heals 10% stronger and increases their resistances by 15%
* Runic Armor makes her Q health restore 8% Stronger



These buffs make Soraka's heals significantly stronger, giving herself an extra 18% stronger heal on her Q as well and even making her global ult give her allies 15% more Armor and Magic Resistance. Of course these were indirect buffs similar to how Yasuo and Tryndamere both benefit greatly from Warlord's Bloodlust but I'm shocked barely anyone has complained about her yet. The one time I fought her she basically made her ADC immortal throughout the laning phase.

replies.body: Sustain supports did seem to get a buff this preseason, and that's OK with me, even as someone who's not really a big sustain support player.

All Sustain Supports got buffed but I think Soraka got buffed the most by far. She can make use of her Q's sustain, and Grevious Wounds was the only major counter to Soraka's early game (not that it was even available much anyways)

soraka has no means to restore her own HP unless she consistantly lands Qs on enemy players, so she can only heal for so long.

If by stagnation you mean 2 enemy laners who dont even poke one another than sure i can see how its an issue.

You beat soraka lanes by constantly poking their ADC forcing her to burn all her HP healing.

Its strategy that wins lanes, not stagnation making them boring. but hey, what do i know? im not the one going around forums downvoting as if upvotes or downvotes even matter. Keep on keepin on joe dirt
No, the strategy to win the lane is to burn Soraka down instantly since she's squishy as heck. Don't waste your poke on the enemy ADC, just explode the super squishy Soraka.

They buffed Soraka's Q restoration with the masteries, they're 18% more effective on herself. Not to mention that if she hits it into the center I believe the heal is increased (along with the damage and a slow is applied).

It also hugely buffed Soraka's solo lane which is kind of irrelevant since she's not that great as a solo laner but still nonetheless made her an uncounterable sustain bot.

God forbit she build tanky like before making every engage a loss
If you can't kill soraka trying to kill anyone on her team becomes a lot harder
Yeah, she works really well with AP and Tankiness. Support or solo lane she just synergizes well with a ton of items but her building tanky is just freelo. It's like a permanent soft taunt.

In my opinion, IF she feels too strong it'll be because of Windspeaker's Blessing and Runic Armor, but if something has to be nerfed it should be her. 

Windspeakers lets the other supports be better at sustain without having to invest in assloads of AP (Sona, Nami, Janna, Bard), so if Soraka is nerfed then everyone can still use that mastery like they are right now. 

And before anyone thinks I hate Soraka or anything she was my second most played champion last season; https://i.gyazo.com/8c1efa76ab68ef1df52f0f1ebeb51467.png 
I'm just looking out for the other sustain supports that are finally being played more.
1st thing I did after seeing patch notes was sorara it up.

i did i feal like its to hard to kill her adc in lane now for how strong she is in teamfights she has allways been pretty op in those http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/zxVwZmf6-change-grievous-wounds-system-heres-why this was my solution into making this work for both partys

soraka since her rework has always been able to keep people alive by spamming heal on them, but she is still very vulnerable. If you have someone like VI who can cut through her allies front line and get right to her shes a sitting duck.

Soraka needed a nice buff ( sona also got one ) through these masteries but i feel like it makes her feel more like the healer she use to be, and thats a good thing. I think everyone will admit how tired of the super tank support they are, its good to get a little more diversity back in this game

Except soraka makes every bot lane a boring farm fest, which is not how *anyone* wants to play the game. There's no point in trying to poke a soraka lane. Meanwhile, a soraka lane doesn't have much kill potential unless you make the mistake of all-inning her ADC, since she lacks lockdown. All you can do is farm up and hope you're better at last hitting than the other dude, and that maybe your jungler comes to gank before theirs does. 

Soraka is a champ that should always be kept intentionally weak, because when she's strong it just results in stagnation in the bot lane.
